metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: jQuery Stop Animations
The jQuery stop() method is used to stop animations or effects before it is finished.
content.html: The jQuery stop() method is used to stop animations or effects before it is finished.

content.text: Click to slide down/up the panel
content.html: Click to slide down/up the panel

content.text: Because time is valuable, we deliver quick and easy learning.
content.html: Because time is valuable, we deliver quick and easy learning.

content.text: At W3Schools, you can study everything you need to learn, in an accessible and handy format.
content.html: At W3Schools, you can study everything you need to learn, in an accessible and handy format.

Demonstrates the jQuery stop() method.

content.text: jQuery stop() Method
The jQuery stop() method is used to stop an animation or effect before it is finished.
content.html: The jQuery stop() method is used to stop an animation or effect before it is finished.

content.text: The stop() method works for all jQuery effect functions, including sliding, fading and custom animations.
content.html: The stop() method works for all jQuery effect functions, including sliding, fading and custom animations.

content.text: Syntax:

The optional stopAll parameter specifies whether also the animation queue should be cleared or not. Default is false, which means that only the active animation will be stopped, allowing any queued animations to be performed afterwards.
content.html: The optional stopAll parameter specifies whether also the animation queue should be cleared or not. Default is false, which means that only the active animation will be stopped, allowing any queued animations to be performed afterwards.

content.text: The optional goToEnd parameter specifies whether or not to complete the current animation immediately. Default is false.
content.html: The optional goToEnd parameter specifies whether or not to complete the current animation immediately. Default is false.

content.text: So, by default, the stop() method kills the current animation being performed on the selected element.
content.html: So, by default, the stop() method kills the current animation being performed on the selected element.

content.text: The following example demonstrates the stop() method, with no parameters:
content.html: The following example demonstrates the stop() method, with no parameters:

content.code_html:
$("#stop").click(function(){
  $("#panel").stop();
});

content.html: Use a jQuery method to stop the animation effect of a <div> element.
